Annotation.note:
Through the vertices of a triangle $ABC$ are drawn three parallel lines, of arbitrary direction, and the perpendiculars to these line through the same vertices. Three rectangles are thus obtained of which the sides $BC$, $CA$, $AB$ are diagonals, respectively. Prove that the three remaining diagonals of these rectangles meet in a point on the nine-point circle of $ABC$.
\begin{keywords} geometry theorem proving \end{keywords}
